meanings.definition: To stay in a temporary camp without shelter.
meanings.sent1: During our hike, we will be bivouacking in the mountains overnight.
meanings.sent2: Soldiers often practice bivouacking in the wilderness to prepare for missions.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to try bivouacking in the backyard for a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the hikers began bivouacking under the open sky.
meanings.sent5: The survival expert demonstrated bivouacking techniques in the survival course.

meanings.definition: The act of setting up a temporary camp without shelter.
meanings.sent1: The bivouacking of the troops was necessary during the military exercise.
meanings.sent2: After a long day of hiking, the bivouacking process began at the designated spot.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended they were bivouacking explorers in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The bivouacking of the nomadic tribe was a sight to behold in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The bivouacking site was chosen strategically near the water source for convenience.
